bio:treatment.discussion: Known only from the type locality in the Queen Charlotte Islands, Seligeria careyana is characterized by its emergent, ovate capsules, which tend to become turbinate with a flaring mouth when old and dry. The leaves are linear, with an extremely long, slender subula formed almost entirely of the costa. The leaves, except for the interior perichaetial ones, rarely flare outward to any extent at the base.
